google_reviews.author: Alexandria Watson
google_reviews.review: I truly wish that I could give Texas Community Management 0 stars. They deem it an acceptable practice to tow vehicles of residents at their properties for no good reason and refuse to speak with them on the matter. My vehicle was towed after I parked in my assigned parking space. This is the second time this has happened. I was aware that management was having the parking spaces painted and that parking was restricted on July 24-25. I moved my vehicles so the spaces could be painted on July 24, and I moved them back because painting was complete by my building. MY VEHICLE WAS STILL TOWED AND NO ATTEMPT WAS MADE TO CONTACT ME. I attempted to speak with someone on this matter, but Jessica refused to speak with me. I do not understand this because I was able to speak with someone the last time my vehicle was wrongfully towed. She also proceeded to hang up when I asked if there was someone else I could speak to or a corporate office. That was very unsettling and very unprofessional. I would advise any and everyone against dealing with Texas Community Management.

google_reviews.author: Fayeza Khan
google_reviews.review: I live in Great Oaks South subdivision and i don't see what the HOA does for this community. We purchased a house here and I had to follow up with them 3 months in a row before they just sent me an invoice. No welcome newsletter or information just an invoice. I notice there are cars parked on the front yard grass, people have broken fences, there's absolutely no landscaping anywhere or trees for HOA to maintain.  So I'm not sure what my money is going towards. Noone ever answers when I call or returns my calls. How does one go on about changing this HOA because this is literally us throwing money in garbage ...

google_reviews.author: Jacquelyn Guilbeaux
google_reviews.review: This is the worst management company ever! They illegally posted private documents on front doors throughout the neighborhood. The "case manager" Patricia is inefficient & incompetent if she is ever in the office she never knows what is going on. To get any information the secretary is more helpful! The owner of the company was at one time in charge of my neighborhood & sent out a letter that clearly showed he didn't even know the bylaws of our hoa. The accounting department is unorganized & incompetent just like the rest of them. The only thing this company seems interested in doing is collecting dues. They also can't manage the financials efficiently for any neighborhood improvement. Other than that you could get better management from a potted plant.

summary.text:
Good

Despite the largely negative feedback, there are a few user reviews highlighting positive encounters with Elite Association Management Company. One user noted a professional experience, where the company's representatives provided valuable suggestions for home improvements that increased property value. This indicates instances where the company excels in customer relations by offering insightful advice to homeowners.

Another user expressed appreciation for the quick and efficient service they received from Elite Association Management Company. This user was pleased with how swiftly they obtained their association's documents and had their questions answered promptly. Such feedback suggests that while rare, there are occasions when the company delivers commendable service to its clients.

Great

Elite Association Management Company receives praise from users who describe experiences of excellent customer service and smooth management operations. The ability to build strong relationships with homeowners is noted as a highlight, with users expressing satisfaction over professional interactions and willingness to address needs effectively. This suggests that when the service works, it works very well.

Another instance of exceptional service is highlighted by users who could not only get their queries answered immediately but also received comprehensive explanations regarding property enhancements. Such positive reviews, although few, underline the company's potential in providing valuable and beneficial homeowner support when the right approach is taken by their staff.

Bad

Elite Association Management Company faces criticism for its lack of responsiveness and communication failures, as highlighted in multiple user reviews. Customers express frustration over unanswered calls and emails, illustrating a frequent inability to reach the company for urgent matters. This communication gap raises concerns among homeowners regarding the company's reliability in managing their properties.

Further feedback points to issues with billing inaccuracies and failure to resolve financial disputes. Users recount long periods of unresolved billing errors and difficulties in obtaining transparent explanations from the company. Such concerns suggest possible inefficiencies within the company's administrative processes that negatively affect the overall customer experience.

Ugly

The most severe grievances against Elite Association Management Company include accusations of unethical behavior and misconduct. One user reported being charged unjustly and facing threats of illegal lien filings without prior communication. Such situations indicate deep-rooted issues in the company's operational transparency and ethical standards.

Further darkening the company's reputation are experiences involving staff rudeness and unprofessionalism. Multiple user reviews describe instances of hostile interactions with staff, particularly a case manager known for being dismissive and uncooperative. Reports of towing resident vehicles without due cause add to the narrative of a management entity acting without accountability, severely undermining homeowner trust.
